A New Scenario Decomposition Method for Large-Scale Stochastic Optimization
items.abstract: <jats:p> A novel parallel decomposition algorithm is developed for large, multistage stochastic optimization problems. The method decomposes the problem into subproblems that correspond to scenarios. The subproblems are modified by separable quadratic terms to coordinate the scenario solutions. Convergence of the coordination procedure is proven for linear programs. Subproblems are solved using a nonlinear interior point algorithm. The approach adjusts the degree of decomposition to fit the available hardware environment. Initial testing on a distributed network of workstations shows that an optimal number of computers depends upon the work per subproblem and its relation to the communication capacities. The algorithm has promise for solving stochastic programs that lie outside current capabilities. </jats:p>

title: SO(10): A possible scenario for new physics in the neutrino sector and baryogenesis
COMPLEX FEIGENBAUM’S SCENARIO IN DISCRETELY-COUPLED ARRAYS OF NONLINEAR CIRCUITS
container-title: International Journal of Bifurcation and Chaos
items.abstract: <jats:p> Complex Feigenbaum’s scenarios were numerically and experimentally observed in discretely coupled arrays of nonlinear circuits. The dependence of the double-period bifurcation scheme on the number of the cells in the array, the coupling between cells, and external noise, was investigated. The complexity of this scenario is highlighted when a two-parameters study was carried out. The unfolding of an inverse double-period cascade was observed in the two-parameter space. </jats:p>

title: Interventional telemedicine for noninvasive neuroradiosurgery: Remote-site high-performance computing, mathematical optimization, and virtual scenario simulation
